contentrichtext.text: {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=[[File:USS N-1 (SS-53).jpg|300px]] |Ship caption=USS ''N-1'' ca. 1921 }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag= {{USN flag|1931}} |Ship name=USS ''N-1'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered= |Ship builder=Seattle Construction and Drydock Company, [[Seattle]], [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]] |Ship laid down=26 July 1915 |Ship launched=30 December 1916 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=26 September 1917 |Ship decommissioned=30 April 1926 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck=18 December 1930 |Ship renamed= |Ship reclassified= |Ship homeport= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honors= |Ship fate=Scrapped, early 1931 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type= [[United States N class submarine|N class]] [[submarine]] |Ship displacement={{convert|348|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} surfaced<br/>{{convert|414|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} submerged |Ship length= {{convert|147|ft|3|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{convert|15|ft|9|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= {{convert|12|ft|6|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship propulsion=[[Diesel-electric]] |Ship speed={{convert|13|kn|lk=in}} surfaced<br/>{{convert|11|kn}} submerged |Ship range= |Ship test depth= |Ship complement=25 officers and men |Ship armament=• 4 × {{convert|18|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} [[torpedo tube]]s |Ship armor= |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''N-1'' (SS-53)''' was the lead ship of [[United States N class submarine|her class of coastal defense submarine]] of the [[United States Navy]]. Her keel was laid down on 26 July 1915 by [[Seattle Construction and Drydock]] Company in [[Seattle]], [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]]. She was [[ship naming and launching|launched]] on 30 December 1916 sponsored by Mrs. Guy E. Davis, and [[ship commissioning|commissioned]] on 26 September 1917 with Lieutenant [[George Trever|George A. Trever]] in command. ==Service history== ''N-1'' was fitted out at [[Puget Sound Navy Yard]] and then departed on 21 November 1917 for [[San Francisco, California]], in company with her sisters {{USS|N-2|SS-54|3}} and {{USS|N-3|SS-55|3}}. Reassigned to the East Coast, she departed San Francisco on 13 December for [[Balboa, Panama|Balboa]], [[Panama Canal Zone]], and thence proceeded via [[Cristóbal, Panama|Cristobal]], [[Jamaica]], [[Key West, Florida]], and [[Norfolk, Virginia]], to [[New London, Connecticut]], arriving on 7 February 1918. Reporting for duty to Commander, First Naval District, the submarine began her first patrol on 23 June by hunting for a [[U-boat]] reported in the vicinity of [[Cape Cod]]. After an intensive but fruitless search, ''N-1'' continued her patrol off the [[New England]] coast. For the remainder of the war and until early 1922, ''N-1'' continued her operations in the area from New London to [[Bar Harbor]]. Placed in reduced commission on 1 May 1922, ''N-1'' became a training submarine for the Submarine School, New London. She continued this duty until ordered to [[Philadelphia Navy Yard]] on 9 December 1925. Arriving at [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]], on 18 December, she was decommissioned on 30 April 1926. Struck from the [[Naval Vessel Register]] on 18 December 1930, ''N-1'' was scrapped in early 1931. == References == {{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/n1/n-1.htm}} ==External links== * {{navsource|08/08053|USS N-1}} {{United States N class submarine}} {{DEFAULTSORT:N-01 (SS-53)}} [[Category:United States N-class submarines]] [[Category:World War I submarines of the United States]] [[Category:Ships built in Washington (state)]] [[Category:1916 ships]]
